content.new:
I know you guys have been updating model files, so this morning, I deleted my ignition models folder to get updated

```
rm -fr ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/
```

It seems like X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_4 no longer has 3D lidar point clouds publishing to an /<robotname>/points topic

This seems relevant from the ignition terminal printout:

```
Failed to create a bridge for topic [/world/virtual_stix/model/X3/link/base_link/sensor/front_laser/scan/points] with ROS1 type [sensor_msgs/PointCloud2] and Ignition Transport type [ignition.msgs.PointCloudPacked]
```

The topic should possibly just be /points, not /front\_laser/scan/points?
content.old:
I know you guys have been updating model files, so this morning, I deleted my ignition models folder to get updated

```
rm -fr ~/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/
```

It seems like X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_4 no longer has 3D lidar point clouds publishing to an /<robotname>/points topic, so I tried launching all of the configurations

```
ign launch -v 4 competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=X2 robotConfig2:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_2 robotName3:=X3 robotConfig3:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_4
```

This seems relevant from the ignition terminal printout:

```
Failed to create a bridge for topic [/world/virtual_stix/model/X3/link/base_link/sensor/front_laser/scan/points] with ROS1 type [sensor_msgs/PointCloud2] and Ignition Transport type [ignition.msgs.PointCloudPacked]
```

The topic should possibly just be /points, not /front\_laser/scan/points?

issue.title: X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_4 model not publishing points again
